<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29071).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [vasild](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29071#issuecomment-1969467516) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29847](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29847) (test: add a few more base32/64 calculation corner cases by paplorinc)
* [#29165](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29165) (build: Bump clang minimum supported version to 15 by maflcko)
* [#29077](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29077) ([WIP, DO NOT MERGE!!11111!!!!!] build: Require libc++-16 or later by maflcko)
* [#28687](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28687) (C++20 std::views::reverse by stickies-v)
* [#26606](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26606) (wallet: Implement independent BDB parser by achow101)
* [#26596](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26596) (wallet: Migrate legacy wallets to descriptor wallets without requiring BDB by achow101)
* [#26593](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26593) (tracing: Only prepare tracepoint arguments when actually tracing by 0xB10C)
* [#25972](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25972) (build: no-longer disable WARN_CXXFLAGS when CXXFLAGS is set by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Looks like this also fails on macOS on GHA. Does anyone know what version(s) of clang can be expected to be available on macOS normally?

> Looks like this also fails on macOS on GHA.

Pretty sure that job should be rerun, because it's failing in the brew install stage.

> Does anyone know what version(s) of clang can be expected to be available on macOS normally?

GIven our minimum supported macOS (11.x), you could run anything from Xcode 12.5+ onwards, which is roughly LLVM/Clang 12+. Although I'd expect most users compiling from source on macOS, would be using a much more recent Xcode, so likely Clang ~14+ at least.

Also, anyone should be able to install and run the latest LLVM/Clang via brew.
Shouldn't our `Span` be dropped completely, now that we have C++20 and `std::span`?
Yes, this change is required to move from `Span` toward `std::span`. (Clarified in the description)
